item.title: XImage (Indexed/debatable image format)
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

private static int[] decode(int j, int k, byte[] abyte0)
	{
		int i = 4;
		int l = abyte0[i++] & 0xff;
		int j1 = j * k;
		if (l == 3)
		{
			int[] k1 = new int[j1];
			for (int i1 = 0; i1 < j1; i1++)
				k1[i1] = ((abyte0[i++] & 0xff) << 16) + ((abyte0[i++] & 0xff) << 8) + (abyte0[i++] & 0xff);

			if (i != abyte0.length)
				System.out.println("checklength " + i + " / " + abyte0.length);

			return k1;
		}
		else if (l == 2)
		{
			int[] k1 = new int[j * k];
			int l1 = ((abyte0[i++] & 0xff) << 8) + (abyte0[i++] & 0xff);
			int[] j2 = new int[l1];
			int i1;
			for (i1 = 0; i1 < l1; i1++)
				j2[i1] = ((abyte0[i++] & 0xff) << 16) + ((abyte0[i++] & 0xff) << 8) + (abyte0[i++] & 0xff);

			for (i1 = 0; i1 < j1; i1++)
				k1[i1] = j2[((abyte0[i++] & 0xff) << 8) + (abyte0[i++] & 0xff)];

			if (i != abyte0.length)
				System.out.println("checklength " + i + " / " + abyte0.length);

			return k1;
		}
		else if (l == 1)
		{
			int[] k1 = new int[j * k];
			int l1 = abyte0[i++] & 0xff;
			int[] j2 = new int[l1];
			int i1;
			for (i1 = 0; i1 < l1; i1++)
				j2[i1] = ((abyte0[i++] & 0xff) << 16) + ((abyte0[i++] & 0xff) << 8) + (abyte0[i++] & 0xff);

			for (i1 = 0; i1 < j1; i1++)
				k1[i1] = j2[abyte0[i++] & 0xff];

			if (i != abyte0.length)
				System.out.println("checklength " + i + " / " + abyte0.length);

			return k1;
		}
		else
		{
			System.out.println("unknown type:" + l);
			return null;
		}
	}

	private static byte[] encode(int j, int k, int[] l)
	{
		int j1 = j * k;
		int[] k1 = new int[16777216];
		int l1 = 0;
		int i;
		int i1;
		int i2;
		for (i = 0; i < j1; i++)
		{
			l[i] &= 16777215;
			i1 = l[i];
			if (k1[i1] == 0)
				l1++;

			k1[i1]++;
		}

		if (l1 > 65535)
		{
			byte[] abyte0 = new byte[j1 * 3 + 4 + 1];
			i = 0;
			System.out.println("norm rgb len:" + abyte0.length);
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) (j >> 8);
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) j;
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) (k >> 8);
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) k;
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) 3;
			for (i1 = 0; i1 < j1; i1++)
			{
				abyte0[i++] = (byte) (l[i1] >> 16);
				abyte0[i++] = (byte) (l[i1] >> 8);
				abyte0[i++] = (byte) l[i1];
			}

			return abyte0;
		}
		else if (l1 > 255)
		{
			byte[] abyte0 = new byte[4 + 1 + 2 + l1 * 3 + j1 * 2];
			System.out.println("word idx rgb len:" + abyte0.length);
			i = 0;
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) (j >> 8);
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) j;
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) (k >> 8);
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) k;
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) 2;
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) (l1 >> 8);
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) l1;
			i1 = 0;
			for (i2 = 0; i1 < l1; i2++)
				if (k1[i2] != 0)
				{
					abyte0[i++] = (byte) (i2 >> 16);
					abyte0[i++] = (byte) (i2 >> 8);
					abyte0[i++] = (byte) i2;
					k1[i2] = i1++;
				}

			for (i1 = 0; i1 < j1; i1++)
			{
				i2 = k1[l[i1]];
				abyte0[i++] = (byte) (i2 >> 8);
				abyte0[i++] = (byte) i2;
			}

			if (i != abyte0.length)
				System.out.println("checklength " + i + " / " + abyte0.length);

			return abyte0;
		}
		else
		{
			byte[] abyte0 = new byte[j1 + 1 + l1 * 3 + 4 + 1];
			System.out.println("byte idx rgb len:" + abyte0.length);
			i = 0;
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) (j >> 8);
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) j;
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) (k >> 8);
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) k;
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) 1;
			abyte0[i++] = (byte) l1;
			i1 = 0;
			for (i2 = 0; i1 < l1; i2++)
				if (k1[i2] != 0)
				{
					abyte0[i++] = (byte) (i2 >> 16);
					abyte0[i++] = (byte) (i2 >> 8);
					abyte0[i++] = (byte) i2;
					k1[i2] = i1++;
				}

			for (i1 = 0; i1 < j1; i1++)
			{
				i2 = k1[l[i1]];
				abyte0[i++] = (byte) i2;
			}

			if (i != abyte0.length)
				System.out.println("checklength " + i + " / " + abyte0.length);

			return abyte0;
		}
	}

Either you are able to write obfuscated code naturally (in that case, this is shit code), or you ripped this (you are shit).
